messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
How cold does it get this Friday?
Sure—could you tell me the location (city or ZIP/postcode) you’d like the forecast for?
No problem—could you give me at least an approximate location (for example, the nearest city, town, or postal code)? I need that to look up Friday’s low temperature.
I’m not sure. I guess you can use location services if needed.

I don’t automatically have access to your device’s location. If you can share either:

• the name of your city/town (or a nearby one),  
• a ZIP/postcode, or  
• your latitude and longitude,

I can look up Friday’s forecast low for you. Let me know whichever is easiest.
Sorry, I don't have that info right now.

To look up Friday’s temperature I have to tell the weather service which place to search, and that requires at least an approximate location (city/town name, ZIP/postcode, or latitude-longitude). Unfortunately I can’t determine your location automatically.

If you’re able to get any of these details later—perhaps by:
• typing the name of the nearest city or village,  
• copying the ZIP/postcode from a piece of mail, or  
• finding your coordinates in a maps app (tap-hold → “Dropped pin” → see numbers like 40.7, -74.0)—

let me know and I’ll grab the forecast right away. Until then I don’t have enough information to give an accurate answer.
